meanings.definition: To participate in a religious ceremony with others
meanings.sent1: The community concelebrates the special Mass every Sunday.
meanings.sent2: The congregation concelebrates important holidays together.
meanings.sent3: The animals in the forest decided to concelebrate the sunrise each day.
meanings.sent4: The stars and moon concelebrate the night sky with their shimmering presence.
meanings.sent5: The children concelebrate their friendship with a secret handshake.

meanings.sent1: The family concelebrates birthdays with a big party.
meanings.sent2: The team concelebrates their victory with high-fives and cheers.
meanings.sent3: The vegetables and fruits concelebrate in the colorful harvest festival.
meanings.sent4: The colors of the rainbow concelebrate in the sky after the rain.
meanings.sent5: The students concelebrate the end of exams with a picnic in the park.
